articles.headline: A Corner Deli With International Appeal
articles.snippet: Zingerman’s in Ann Arbor, Mich., turns 25 and continues to expand its gourmet enterprise.
articles.abstract: Zingerman’s in Ann Arbor, Mich., turns 25 and continues to expand its gourmet enterprise.
articles.lead_paragraph: ANN ARBOR, Mich., May 2 — On an unseasonably warm Sunday afternoon in mid-March, hundreds of food lovers packed a tent on Detroit Street in front of Zingerman’s Delicatessen here, lining up for samples to celebrate the deli’s 25th anniversary.

articles.headline: G.O.P. Contenders Ponder What to Say About Bush
articles.snippet: The Republican presidential candidates are wrestling over how to deal with the president as they gather for their first debate.
articles.abstract: The Republican presidential candidates are wrestling over how to deal with the president as they gather for their first debate.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, May 2 — As they gather Thursday night at the Ronald Reagan Presidential Library for their first debate, the Republican presidential candidates are thrilled at the chance to associate themselves with Reagan. But they may not be able to escape the challenge created for them by the current president.

articles.headline: China Food Mislabeled, U.S. Says
articles.snippet: U.S. regulators said a Chinese company avoided inspections partly because it did not correctly disclose its shipping contents to Chinese authorities.
articles.abstract: U.S. regulators said a Chinese company avoided inspections partly because it did not correctly disclose its shipping contents to Chinese authorities.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI, May 2 — A Chinese company accused of selling contaminated wheat gluten to American pet food suppliers avoided inspections partly because it did not correctly disclose its shipping contents to Chinese export authorities, according to American regulators.

articles.headline: Iraqi Blocs  Opposed to Draft Oil Bill
articles.snippet: Kurdish and Sunni Arab officials are concerned over a draft of a bill establishing a framework for the distribution of oil revenues.
articles.abstract: Kurdish and Sunni Arab officials are concerned over a draft of a bill establishing a framework for the distribution of oil revenues.
articles.lead_paragraph: ERBIL, Iraq, May 2 — Kurdish and Sunni Arab officials expressed deep reservations on Wednesday about the draft version of a national oil law and related legislation, misgivings that could derail one of the benchmark measures of progress in Iraq laid down by President Bush.
articles.byline: By Edward Wong and Sheryl Gay Stolberg

articles.headline: Wall Street Journal Weighs Life Under Murdoch
articles.snippet: The media baron is known to take a hands-on approach to his politically barbed and sometimes racy properties.
articles.abstract: The media baron is known to take a hands-on approach to his politically barbed and sometimes racy properties.
articles.lead_paragraph: Rupert Murdoch has spent years thinking about what he would do with The Wall Street Journal if he could just get his hands on it. Based on his business history, he often gets what he wants.

articles.headline: In Web Uproar, Antipiracy Code Spreads Wildly
articles.snippet: Sophisticated Internet users have joined up to distribute a code used to prevent piracy of high-definition movies.
articles.abstract: Sophisticated Internet users have joined up to distribute a code used to prevent piracy of high-definition movies.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, May 2 — There is open revolt on the Web.

articles.headline: I.R.S. Curtails Many Audits in Tax Havens
articles.snippet: Stalling tactics have made it hard to complete the audits within the required three years, investigators say.
articles.abstract: Stalling tactics have made it hard to complete the audits within the required three years, investigators say.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 2  The Internal Revenue Service is curtailing audits of many people who use offshore tax havens, even when agents see signs of tax evasion, because agents fear they cannot meet a three-year deadline for finishing an examination, Congressional investigators have found.

articles.headline: Your Life, in a Movie of Top Quality
articles.snippet: New camcorders from Sony and JVC give home movies the same kind of clarity as Hollywood releases.
articles.abstract: New camcorders from Sony and JVC give home movies the same kind of clarity as Hollywood releases.
articles.lead_paragraph: “Wow” is typical. “Jeez” is another favorite. “Man, look at that” is a runner-up.

articles.headline: First the Bid, Now the Jockeying
articles.snippet: The board of Dow Jones left enough room for Rupert Murdoch to work his powers of persuasion on the Bancroft family.
articles.abstract: The board of Dow Jones left enough room for Rupert Murdoch to work his powers of persuasion on the Bancroft family.
articles.lead_paragraph: And now for the charm offensive.
